text:
Hi all, I don’t suppose anyone would happen to know if we can make module fields display conditionally to multiple other fields?
at the moment we can only choose one field and say ‘is equal to’ / ‘not empty’ etc. but i find often at times for more complex modules, multiple conditions are necessary to keep the author experience clean and tidy.

I found this post from over a year back asking for similar
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Custom-Module-Conditional-Fields-With-Multiple-Conditions/idi-p/203626>

if anyone knows how to do this or something similar, please let me know ^^

Thanks

I think you should be able to make this happen using jinja logic operators “and” and/or “or”.

`{% if true and (1 + 1 == 3) %} <span>This span does not print</span> {% endif %}`

The previous code block works when I tested it and it doesnt print  because 1+1 != 3

you should be able to switch this logic out with any module values if I am not mistaken.

Does that make sense?
This span wi
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/operators-and-expression-tests> Here are the logic operators for hubl — is this what you were asking?
